Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @blankmac - BasementPool the new Hush is not just disabling/removing Sprout. We are mining a new genesis block and there are consensus rules forbidding any sprout transaction to ever exist, or Sprout UTXO to ever exist. None of the sprout code exists anymore in the KMD/HUSH codebase. HUSH is the first chain to be Sapling from the genesis block, to my knowledge. First chain ever to use -ac_sapling=1 in KMD world, which means enforce sapling from block 1

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> most existing chains disabled Sprout, or have the updated "safer groth16" implementation of Sprout from Zcash, which they still use

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> KMD disabled it (which goes for all asset chains), but ZEN uses the latest Zcash sprout code, for instance

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I agree with jl777 that sprout support is not worth it (more of a bug than a feature), and the latest horrible bug in ZEC sprout nullifiers/commitments is a great example of that.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Cryptographic> do i need to do anything to be ready for the fork?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Berg> If your funds are being kept on an exchange or in the web wallet, no. If not, make sure your funds are in a transparent address (beginning with a T)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Berg> If they're in a Z address, (only about 1% of all HUSH at the moment) then you'll need to send them over to a T address

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Berg> That's all that needs to be done üòÉ You can read more at https://myhush.org/sapling

Content: [dscrd-hush] <Berg> @JiveBuddha We're migrating to become a Komodo Asset Chain, you can read updates on Twitter and see what Duke has been working on through GitHub, very very exciting times

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @JiveBuddha we have a new Git repo for our new KMD-based code and new chain

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> this is the "old" Hush v2: https://github.com/myhush/hush/

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> the new Hush v3 is a source code fork *AND* asset chain of KMD (similar to VRSC), which currently follows KMD upstream very closely. These are not finalized, but this is what the new chain params of Hush v3 will look like: https://github.com/MyHush/hush3/blob/duke/src/hushd

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> hush3 repo is our new repo, which is a fork of KMD, instead of hush.git, which is a fork of ZEC
